comment.author: 53922404@N05
comment._content:
Great street scene from before WW2. 
In fact no later than 1938, I reckon.
Newest car identifiable is the one driving away from  the photographer -  it appears to have an all steel turret top which became popular from 1936-37 onwards –  its a large, 6 wheel equipped and fairly new car at the time of the photo - bustle boot and the side monted spare suggest no later than 1938 - I think maybe a Graham, Studebaker, Hudson, Buick. To its left and right are visible the rear sections of 2 late 1930s sedans.
Car coming towards photographer is a 1935 Ford Fordor sedan, judging by the distinctive radiator grill chrome strips. This car and the other sedans parked at the kerb have the older style island  fabric roof (ie. pre all steel body) and date 1928-1935/6.
The soft top tourers and roadsters shown date from the late 1920s to early 1930s (1933-34). Jenny

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/53922404@N05] Thanks Jenny! I've updated the caption here with "late 1930s" and will pass this info along for Photo Investigator to be updated. 

Always impressed with your knowledge of these older cars :)

AB
